result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin Michael Thorpe

defendant.name: Thorpe, Colin Michael
defendant.address: 703 Europe Bay Rd, Ellison Bay, WI 54210

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 11:40 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Colin Michael Thorpe appeared by video.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Colin Michael Thorpe.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at. Atty Kane indicates close to resolution, defendant in out of state treatment, requests a date on 60 days.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Atty Kane Letter to Clerk of Courts
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colin Michael Thorpe appeared by video.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Colin Michael Thorpe. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bind over.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Court lifts Pre-Trial Release Monitoring - Alcohol Monitoring - Medium while defendant is in treatment.  All other conditions remain as previously set.

1:00 PM Defendant Colin Michael Thorpe appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Colin Michael Thorpe. Court addresses request for bond modification.  Defense requests pretrial release monitoring - Alcohol monitoring- Medium be removed while defendant in treatment. Court grants request. Court lifts pretrial release monitoring condition while defendant is in treatment.  All other conditions remain as previously set. Bond form will be emailed to Atty Kane to supply to defendant for signature.
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:09 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colin Michael Thorpe appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for Colin Michael Thorpe.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Kane asks court to reconsider the SCRAM bracelet as a condition of defendants bond as defendant's family would like to get him into treatment.  State opposes request, may not be opposed at a later date.  Court not changing bond today, would be willing to have the bracelet removed once defendant enters treatment and reinstalled when he's released from treatment.  Court advises Atty Kane to contact ADL to look into the logistics once more information is learned.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim. Court approves zoom appearance for next hearing for defendant.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 006426,
Payable Number: 100759,
Receipt Number: 22R 002912,
Amount: $20.00
Cash bond posted by Ryan Mueller.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - Medium Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Colin Thorpe appeared via zoom from the Door County Jail.  Colleen Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
